history.content: 47C is generally a class taken by students who have taken a course that covers some but not all the material covered in 61C and it becomes a way for them to do only the portions of 61C that were not covered in their previous coursework as determined by our faculty. If a student has taken 61C here and failed, they have not received partial credit for 61C and 47C would not be appropriate.

I took and failed 61c due to extenuating circumstances last semester, but I really wanted to minor in CS and this was my last prereq. I came across CS 47C, and was confused as to the logistics of how this works in terms of credit?

The description states:

"Students with sufficient partial credit in 61C may, with consent of instructor, complete the credit in this self-paced course."

But it also states:

"Students will receive no credit for 47C after taking 61C."

Could someone please clarify this for me? Thanks so much!
history.subject: CS 47C after failing 61c
